page.title: 13COMMONERS RIGHTS
page.content: In many areas the local residents had the right to graze animals on any land which was unfenced and lay within the village boundaries. Most of these Commoners Rights,as they were called, were lost during the Enclosures.Rights in Thornwood may have been lost at this time,but the large area of Rye Hill retained its rights till the 1940's.Only a very few local inhabitants could lay claim to these rights.One local farmer is well versed in commoners rights and one of her workers still keeps cattle tethered on the broad verges which are al that remains of the Common.Keeping any livestock in such a way is a very unusual sight in this fenced and hedged arable area.
